natural solution: We can check that $\mathbf{A}$ is invertible, and so \[\mathbf{A} \mathbf{A}^{-1} = \mathbf{I}.\]By the same token, \[\mathbf{A}^{-1} (\mathbf{A}^{-1})^{-1} = \mathbf{I}.\]Therefore, $(\mathbf{A}^{-1})^{-1} = \mathbf{A} = \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 7 \\ 13 & -2 \end{pmatrix}}.$

and h1 : "matrix_inv A = A_inv"
shows  "matrix_inv A_inv = A"
